meanings.definition: In a rude or disrespectful manner
meanings.sent1: She spoke insolently to her teacher, ignoring all rules of politeness.
meanings.sent2: The child behaved insolently towards the elderly lady, causing a scene.
meanings.sent3: The parrot insolently mimicked the teacher's scolding tone, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled insolently through the night, disregarding any attempts at silence.
meanings.sent5: The cat insolently knocked over the vase, as if daring anyone to stop it.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of respect or courtesy
meanings.sent1: His insolently loud laughter disrupted the solemn atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent2: The insolently written note left on the desk offended many of the staff members.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gave an insolently casual wave before darting off with the stolen acorn.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall stood out, its message insolently challenging authority.
meanings.sent5: Her insolently bright outfit clashed with the formal dress code of the event.

meanings.sent1: The student's insolently defiant attitude towards the principal led to detention.
meanings.sent2: The insolently painted graffiti on the wall sparked a debate about street art.
meanings.sent3: The insolently confident squirrel stole a cookie right from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered insolently, ready to unleash their fury on the town.
meanings.sent5: His insolently direct approach to negotiations caught everyone off guard.
